citation.article-title: Exiguobacterium mexicanum sp. nov. and Exiguobacterium artemiae sp. nov., isolated from the brine shrimp Artemia franciscana.

p.s: Description of Exiguobacterium mexicanum sp. nov.
Exiguobacterium mexicanum me.xi.ca’ num N.L. neut. adj. mexicanum, Mexican (Arbitrary name formed from the location of the laboratory where isolation of the strain took place)
Colonies grown in marine agar 2216 (Difco) are 2–3 mm in diameter after 2 days at 28 °C, orange, convex with entire margin and glossy.
Gram-positive, motile, non-spore-forming rods, varying in shape and size of rods from 0.5–0.75 μm in diameter×0.8–3.0 μm in length.
Growth occurs under aerobic and anaerobic conditions in both CASO and marine medium.
Growth occurs at 20 and 41 °C but not at 45 °C.

Catalase and oxidase-positive, utilized α-cyclodextrin, β-cyclodextrin, glycogen, N-acetyl mannosamine, d-ribose, d-sorbitol, turanose, d-xylose, acetic acid, l-lactic acid, propionic acid and cellobiose, other physiological properties are listed in Table 3 and Table 4.
The principal isoprenoid quinones are MK-8, MK-7, MK-6, and MK-9.
Major fatty acids (>5%) are C12:0, iC13:0, aiC13:0, C14:0, C16:0, C16:1ω7c, C16:1ω11c, C16:0, and C18:0; additionally, minor components are listed in Table 3.
Isolated from a commercial can of A. franciscana cysts.
